sub_topic: Calculation of standard enthalpy change for a fusion reaction
message_1: What is the standard enthalpy change for the fusion of 1.5 moles of solid lead (Pb) to liquid lead at its melting point? The molar enthalpy of fusion of lead is 4.79 kJ/mol.
message_2:
The standard enthalpy change for the fusion of 1.5 moles of solid lead (Pb) to liquid lead at its melting point can be calculated using the molar enthalpy of fusion and the number of moles.

Standard enthalpy change (ΔH) = moles × molar enthalpy of fusion

ΔH = 1.5 moles × 4.79 kJ/mol

ΔH = 7.185 kJ

The standard enthalpy change for the fusion of 1.5 moles of solid lead to liquid lead at its melting point is 7.185 kJ.
